Historically, it was the home to Chinese fishers. In the 1980s, European tourists visited the area, making them the first non-Asian visitors and bringing the area out of obscurity. It became popular with backpackers, and remains so today.

The resorts on the beach each have restaurants. Most specialize in Southern Thai food, but also offer Thai and western food. Seafood is popular, including fish, crab, lobster, squid, mussels, scallops and prawns, often cooked in clay pots. You'll also find rice noodles and rice dishes, often served with spicy curry.
